parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The electrical fire in the steering column can cause smoke and odors to fill the passenger compartment, potentially leading to a hazardous situation for the driver and passengers.
symptoms: Smoke coming from the steering wheel
or horn button; smoke and odors filling the passenger compartment; cruise control malfunction.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ignition system can cause the vehicle to stall or fail to start, leading to inconvenience and potential safety risks.
symptoms: Ignition switch or wire failure; ignition failure; premature spark plug failure; ignition coil failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the instrument cluster can cause the driver to lose critical information about the vehicle's operation, potentially leading to safety risks.
symptoms: Instrument cluster failure; loss of critical vehicle information.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the seatbelt latch can cause the seatbelt to unintentionally release, leading to increased risk of injury or fatality in the event of an accident.
symptoms: The seatbelt will not stay hooked in place
the clip on the seatbelt breaks off
the seatbelt releases unintentionally from the clasp
the plastic component that holds the seatbelt shoulder strap to the common buckle breaks in half.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the seatbelt to properly restrain the driver or passenger can cause injuries or fatalities in the event of an accident.
symptoms: The door-mounted shoulder/lap belts fail to hold the driver/passenger in place during an accident

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A punctured brake line can lead to an extended stopping distance, increasing the risk of accidents and injuries.
symptoms: brake pedal goes to the floor

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Braking System Failure (Front and Rear Hub Assembly)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Continuous failure of the front and rear hub assembly can lead to a loss of braking ability, increasing the risk of accidents and injuries.
symptoms: Repeated failure of the front and rear hub assembly

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty brake pedal can cause the pedal to go to the floor, leading to a loss of braking ability and increasing the risk of accidents and injuries.
symptoms: Brake pedal goes to the floor

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the master/slave hydraulic clutch cylinders can cause the clutch pedal to stick to the floor, making it difficult or impossible to shift gears, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: Clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
clutch pedal sticks to the floor
clutch pedal does not return to its normal position.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A brake pedal built too close to the floor can increase the risk of accidents due to unintended acceleration or difficulty braking.
symptoms: Brake pedal is too close to the floor

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electronic EGR valve can cause an underhood exhaust leak, potentially leading to asphyxiation and posing a serious safety risk to occupants.
symptoms: puff of exhaust gas from the EGR valve when snapping the throttle open.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Cracked engine cylinder heads can cause engine failure, leading to a loss of power and potentially causing accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
Head gasket failure can cause engine coolant and oil leaks, leading to engine damage and potentially causing accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
Engine motor mount failure can cause damage to surrounding components, such as the air conditioning system, and lead to premature wear on other engine mounts.
symptoms: Noise and vibration from the engine

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Motor housing failure can cause engine damage and potentially lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
